nav.title: Settings
nav.api-keysDesc: Manage API keys for programmatic access
nav.ai-provider-keysDesc: Configure API keys for Claude, Gemini, and OpenAI

billing.upgradeSuccess: ✓ Your subscription has been upgraded successfully!
billing.upgradeCanceled: Upgrade was canceled. Your current plan remains unchanged.

subscription.title: Current Subscription
subscription.description: Your current plan and billing status.

usage.title: Usage Overview
usage.description: Monitor your resource consumption across your workspace.

limits.exceeded: You've reached the {{resource}} limit for your plan.
limits.globalCritical: Approaching plan limits for {{resources}}. Consider upgrading.
limits.globalExceeded: Plan limit reached for {{resources}}. Upgrade to continue.

planChange.title: Confirm Plan Change
planChange.upgradeDescription: Your new plan will be effective immediately. You'll be charged a prorated amount for the remainder of your billing period.
planChange.downgradeDescription: Your plan change will take effect at the end of your current billing period. You'll continue to have access to your current plan features until then.
planChange.cancelDescription: Your subscription will be canceled at the end of your current billing period. You'll continue to have access until then.
planChange.cancelSuccess: Subscription canceled. You'll have access until the end of your billing period.

appearance.title: Appearance
appearance.description: Customize how the application looks and feels.

language.label: Language
language.helper: Choose your preferred language. Browser Default follows your system language.

taskExecution.title: Default Coding Agent
taskExecution.description: Choose the default coding agent for tasks.

executor.label: Default Agent Configuration
executor.helper: Choose the default agent configuration to use when creating a task attempt.

type.label: Editor Type
type.helper: Choose your preferred code editor interface.

customCommand.label: Custom Editor Command
customCommand.helper: Enter the command to launch your custom editor. This will be used to open files.

host.label: Remote SSH Host (Optional)
host.helper: Set this if iKanban is running on a remote server. When set, clicking "Open in Editor" will generate a URL to open your editor via SSH instead of spawning a local command.

user.label: Remote SSH User (Optional)
user.helper: SSH username for the remote connection. If not set, VS Code will use your SSH config or prompt you.

cliSetup.title: GitHub CLI Setup
cliSetup.description: GitHub CLI authentication is required to create pull requests and interact with GitHub repositories.

steps.checkInstalled: Check if GitHub CLI (gh) is installed
steps.installHomebrew: Install it via Homebrew if needed (macOS)

cliSetup.setupNote: The setup will run in the chat window. You'll need to complete the authentication in your browser.

errors.brewMissing: Homebrew is not installed. Install it to enable automatic setup.
errors.notSupported: Automatic setup is not supported on this platform. Install GitHub CLI manually.
errors.setupFailed: Failed to run GitHub CLI setup.

homebrew.description: Automatic installation requires Homebrew. Install Homebrew from
homebrew.manualInstall: and then rerun the setup. Alternatively, install GitHub CLI manually with:

manual.andAuthenticate: and then authenticate with your GitHub account.

branchPrefix.label: Branch Prefix
branchPrefix.helper: Prefix for auto-generated branch names. Leave empty for no prefix.

autoDescription.label: Auto-generate PR description by default
autoDescription.helper: When enabled, the AI agent will automatically update the PR title and description after creation.

customPrompt.helper: Custom prompt for the AI agent when generating PR descriptions. Use {pr_number} and {pr_url} as placeholders.

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.description: Control when and how you receive notifications.

sound.label: Sound Notifications
sound.helper: Play a sound when task attempts finish running.
sound.fileHelper: Choose the sound to play when tasks complete. Click the volume button to preview.

push.label: Push Notifications
push.helper: Show system notifications when task attempts finish running.

privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.description: Help improve iKanban by sharing anonymous usage data.

telemetry.label: Enable Telemetry
telemetry.helper: Enables anonymous usage events tracking to help improve the application. No prompts or project information are collected.

taskTemplates.title: Tags
taskTemplates.description: Create reusable text snippets that can be inserted into task descriptions using @tag_name.

manager.title: Task Tags
manager.noTags: No tags yet. Create reusable text snippets for common task descriptions. Use @tag_name in any task.
manager.deleteConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the tag "{{tagName}}"?

tagName.label: Tag Name
tagName.hint: Use this name with @ in task descriptions: @{{tagName}}
tagName.error: Tag name cannot contain spaces. Use underscores instead (e.g., my_tag)

content.label: Content
content.hint: Text that will be inserted when you use @{{tagName}} in task descriptions
content.placeholder: Enter the text that will be inserted when you use this tag

safety.title: Safety & Disclaimers
safety.description: Reset acknowledgments for safety warnings and onboarding.

agents.title: Coding Agent Configurations
agents.description: Customize the behavior of coding agents with different configurations.

availability.loginDetectedTooltip: Recent authentication credentials found for this agent
availability.installationFoundTooltip: Agent configuration found. You may need to log in to use it.
availability.notFoundTooltip: No previous usage detected. Agent may require installation and/or login.

mode.cliOnlyDescription: Agent runs via local CLI installation
mode.apiOnlyDescription: Agent runs via configured API key
mode.bothDescription: Both CLI and API modes available
mode.noneDescription: Setup required - install CLI or configure API key

errors.deleteFailed: Failed to delete configuration. Please try again.
errors.saveFailed: Failed to save agent configurations. Please try again.
errors.saveConfigFailed: Failed to save configuration. Please try again.

mcp.title: MCP Server Configuration
mcp.description: Configure Model Context Protocol servers to extend coding agent capabilities with custom tools and resources.

summary.title: MCP Configuration Summary
summary.description: Overview of MCP server configurations per agent.
summary.descriptionServers: MCP servers configured for the current agent.
summary.addServerHint: Add servers using the JSON editor below or select from popular servers

keyReference.title: API Key References
keyReference.description: Use secure key references instead of exposing API keys in your configuration.
keyReference.syntaxHelp: Replace "provider_name" with: openai, anthropic, or google
keyReference.manageKeys: Manage API keys in AI Provider Keys

labels.agentHelper: Choose which agent to configure MCP servers for.
labels.serverHelper: Click a card to insert that MCP Server into the JSON above.

errors.applyFailed: Failed to apply MCP server configuration
errors.supportMessage: To use MCP servers, please select a different executor that supports MCP (Claude, Amp, Gemini, Codex, or Opencode) above.

selector.label: Select Project
selector.helper: Select a project to view and edit its configuration.

name.label: Project Name
name.helper: A display name for this project.

repoPath.label: Git Repository Path
repoPath.helper: The absolute path to your git repository on disk.

scripts.title: Scripts & Configuration
scripts.description: Configure setup, cleanup, and copy files for this project.

setup.label: Setup Script
setup.helper: This script runs from within the worktree after it's created and before the coding agent starts. Use it for setup tasks like installing dependencies or preparing the environment.
setup.parallelLabel: Run setup script in parallel with coding agent
setup.parallelHelper: When enabled, the setup script runs simultaneously with the coding agent instead of waiting for setup to complete first.

dev.label: Dev Server Script
dev.helper: Starts a development server from task attempts. Scripts execute from the workspace directory (one level above each repo's worktree) unless a working directory is specified below.

devWorkingDir.label: Dev Server Working Directory
devWorkingDir.helper: The directory to run the dev server script from, relative to the workspace root. Leave empty to run from the workspace root.

agentWorkingDir.label: Agent Working Directory
agentWorkingDir.helper: Default directory for new workspaces to run the coding agent from, relative to the workspace root. This value is captured when a workspace is created and won't affect existing workspaces. For single-repo projects, this defaults to the repo name. Leave empty to run from the workspace root.

cleanup.label: Cleanup Script
cleanup.helper: This script runs from within the worktree after coding agent execution, only if changes were made. Use it for quality assurance tasks like running linters, formatters, tests, or other validation steps. If no changes are made, this script is skipped.

copyFiles.label: Copy Files
copyFiles.helper: Comma-separated list of files to copy from the original project directory to the worktree. These files will be copied after the worktree is created but before the setup script runs. Useful for environment-specific files like .env, configuration files, and local settings. Make sure these are gitignored or they could get committed!

save.confirmSwitch: You have unsaved changes. Are you sure you want to switch projects? Your changes will be lost.

apiKeys.title: API Keys
apiKeys.description: Create and manage API keys for programmatic access to the API. Use these keys with MCP servers, CLI tools, and other integrations.
apiKeys.noKeysHint: Create an API key to enable programmatic access to the API.

usage.title: Using API Keys
usage.description: Include your API key in the Authorization header of your requests. API keys start with 'vk_' and provide the same access as your user account.
usage.mcpHint: For MCP servers, set the VIBE_API_TOKEN environment variable in your Claude Code settings.

createDialog.title: Create API Key
createDialog.description: Give your API key a descriptive name so you can identify it later.
createDialog.namePlaceholder: e.g., Claude Code MCP, CI/CD Pipeline
createDialog.nameHint: Choose a name that describes how this key will be used.

createdDialog.title: API Key Created
createdDialog.description: Your new API key has been created. Copy it now - you won't be able to see it again!
createdDialog.warning: Make sure to copy your API key now. For security reasons, we won't show it again.

deleteDialog.title: Delete API Key
deleteDialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete the API key "{{name}}"?
deleteDialog.warning: Any applications using this key will immediately lose access. This action cannot be undone.

aiProviderKeys.title: AI Provider Keys
aiProviderKeys.description: Configure API keys for AI providers (Claude, Gemini, OpenAI) to enable AI-powered features in the application.
aiProviderKeys.noWorkspace: Please select a workspace to manage AI provider keys.
aiProviderKeys.noKeysHint: Add your AI provider API keys to enable AI-powered features.

errors.loadFailed: Failed to load AI provider keys

info.title: Supported Providers
info.description: Add API keys for the AI providers you want to use. These keys are securely stored and used for AI-powered features within the application.

addDialog.title: Add AI Provider Key
addDialog.description: Enter your API key for the selected provider. The key will be securely stored.

deleteDialog.title: Delete AI Provider Key
deleteDialog.description: Are you sure you want to delete the API key for {{provider}}?
deleteDialog.warning: AI-powered features that depend on this provider will stop working. This action cannot be undone.

cliSetup.title: GitHub CLI Setup
cliSetup.description: GitHub CLI authentication is required to create pull requests and interact with GitHub repositories.

steps.checkInstalled: Check if GitHub CLI (gh) is installed
steps.installHomebrew: Install it via Homebrew if needed (macOS)

cliSetup.setupNote: The setup will run in the chat window. You'll need to complete the authentication in your browser.

errors.brewMissing: Homebrew is not installed. Install it to enable automatic setup.
errors.notSupported: Automatic setup is not supported on this platform. Install GitHub CLI manually.
errors.setupFailed: Failed to run GitHub CLI setup.

homebrew.description: Automatic installation requires Homebrew. Install Homebrew from
homebrew.manualInstall: and then rerun the setup. Alternatively, install GitHub CLI manually with:

manual.andAuthenticate: and then authenticate with your GitHub account.
